author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: With just one polka dot, nothing can be achieved. In the universe, there is the sun, the moon, the earth, and hundreds of millions of stars. All of us live in the unfathomable mystery and infinitude of the universe. Pursuing 'philosophy of the universe' through art under such circumstances has led me to what I call 'stereotypical repetition.'
author: Yayoi Kusama

quote: In art, at a certain level, there is no 'better than.' It's just about trying to operate for yourself on the most supreme level, artistically, that you can and hoping that people get it. Trusting that, just because of the way people are built and how interconnected we are, greatness will translate and symmetry will be recognised.
author: Frank Ocean

quote: A picture book is a small door to the enormous world of the visual arts, and they're often the first art a young person sees.
author: Tomie dePaola

quote: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: Art doesn't transform. It just plain forms.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: 'Crazy' is a term of art; 'Insane' is a term of law. Remember that, and you will save yourself a lot of trouble.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: All art is erotic.
author: Gustav Klimt

quote: There is only one valuable thing in art: the thing you cannot explain.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Rhetoric may be defined as the faculty of observing in any given case the available means of persuasion. This is not a function of any other art.
author: Aristotle

quote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Impressionism is the newspaper of the soul.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: For art to exist, for any sort of aesthetic activity to exist, a certain physiological precondition is indispensable: intoxication.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.
author: Rebecca West

quote: There is nothing new in art except talent.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Should graffiti be judged on the same level as modern art? Of course not: It's way more important than that.
author: Banksy

quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Politicians are masters of the art of deception.
author: Martin L. Gross

quote: I try to keep a low profile in general. Not with my art, but just as a person.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: For as long as I can remember I have suffered from a deep feeling of anxiety which I have tried to express in my art.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.
author: Russell Simmons

quote: A sculptor is a person who is interested in the shape of things, a poet in words, a musician by sounds.
author: Henry Moore

quote: What is comedy? Comedy is the art of making people laugh without making them puke.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Abstract art: a product of the untalented sold by the unprincipled to the utterly bewildered.
author: Al Capp

quote: It is after all the greatest art to limit and isolate oneself.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The history of modern art is also the history of the progressive loss of art's audience. Art has increasingly become the concern of the artist and the bafflement of the public.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.
author: Robert Schumann

quote: The task of art today is to bring chaos into order.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Art evokes the mystery without which the world would not exist.
author: Rene Magritte

quote: What is Art? It is the response of man's creative soul to the call of the Real.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Errors are not in the art but in the artificers.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: For me, there is very little difference between magic and art. To me, the ultimate act of magic is to create something from nothing: It's like when the stage magician pulls the rabbit from the hat.
author: Alan Moore

quote: I always saw candy as art.
author: Dylan Lauren

quote: The art of doing mathematics consists in finding that special case which contains all the germs of generality.
author: David Hilbert

quote: When hospitality becomes an art it loses its very soul.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: When thou art at Rome, do as they do at Rome.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Art can only be truly art by presenting an adequate outward symbol of some fact in the interior life.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: Cleanliness is the scourge of art.
author: Craig Brown

quote: The art of living well and the art of dying well are one.
author: Epicurus

quote: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Violin playing is a physical art with great traditions behind it.
author: Vanessa Mae

quote: To curb the machine and limit art to handicraft is a denial of opportunity.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: I don't listen to what art critics say. I don't know anybody who needs a critic to find out what art is.
author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

quote: Art does not reproduce what we see; rather, it makes us see.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Use the creative process - singing, writing, art, dance, whatever - to get to know yourself better.
author: Catie Curtis

quote: There's traditionally been a large disconnection in contemporary art between the audience and the artist. Generally, audiences are looking towards what they like, and I can tell you, that's the last thing on an artist's mind.
author: James Turrell

quote: London, thou art the flower of cities all!
author: William Dunbar

quote: Art is the fatal net which catches these strange moments on the wing like mysterious butterflies, fleeing the innocence and distraction of common men.
author: Giorgio de Chirico

quote: Through a painting we can see the whole world.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: The art of photography is all about directing the attention of the viewer.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: Photographing a cake can be art.
author: Irving Penn

quote: What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Art is about building a new foundation, not just laying something on top of what's already there.
author: Prince

quote: I don't like to say I have given my life to art. I prefer to say art has given me my life.
author: Frank Stella

quote: Art begins in imitation and ends in innovation.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Art is born of humiliation.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Art resides in the quality of doing, process is not magic.
author: Charles Eames

quote: I just love pretty things, whether it is art, a song or a pair of shoes.
author: Rita Ora

quote: A work of art that contains theories is like an object on which the price tag has been left.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Life is short, the art long.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Art, in itself, is an attempt to bring order out of chaos.
author: Stephen Sondheim

quote: Logic: The art of thinking and reasoning in strict accordance with the limitations and incapacities of the human misunderstanding.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: I consider skateboarding an art form, a lifestyle and a sport. 'Action sport' would be the least offensive categorization.
author: Tony Hawk

quote: Censorship is to art as lynching is to justice.
author: Henry Louis Gates

quote: Art is not supposed to change the world, to change practical things, but to change perceptions. Art can change the way we see the world. Art can create an analogy.
author: JR

quote: People discuss my art and pretend to understand as if it were necessary to understand, when it's simply necessary to love.
author: Claude Monet

quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.
author: Gunter Grass

quote: My daughter loves to do art stuff. As a father, I like to play with her. We break out the big pads of paper and the glitter and all the stuff. She likes to do what she likes to do. I want to do something, too. So I've just started using her same materials - a lot of crayons, a lot of sparkle, charcoal, pencils, markers and glue.
author: Stone Gossard

quote: Parks are works of art just as a painting or sculpture is.
author: Thomas Hoving

quote: Art is the elimination of the unnecessary.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Art challenges technology, but technology inspires the art.
author: John Lasseter

quote: My art is not limited to the songs I create but also to the reaction it creates. I like to sit back and look at the whole thing as if it's a tornado that I'm controlling. It's creating chaos. When you create chaos, ideas are turned upside down, and everybody looks at things in a different way.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: What goes on in abstract art is the proclaiming of aesthetic principles... It is in our own time that we have become aware of pure aesthetic considerations. Art never can be imitation.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: Diplomacy, n. is the art of letting somebody else have your way.
author: David Frost

quote: Encouraging young people to believe in themselves and find their own voice whether it's through writing, drama or art is so important in giving young people a sense of self-worth.
author: Michael Morpurgo

quote: I think that art is still a site for resistance and for the telling of various stories, for validating certain subjectivities we normally overlook. I'm trying to be affective, to suggest changes, and to resist what I feel are the tyrannies of social life on a certain level.
author: Barbara Kruger

quote: I paint; I draw and paint - I've been doing that since I was in third grade, drawing realistically and then changing to abstract art. That was my first creative thing before guitar or comedy.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Art is interesting because there can be so many different perspectives in a piece of art. The way I see it may be completely different than the way somebody else sees it. It's interesting to hear what somebody sees in a piece of art compared to somebody else. It could be completely different, and that's interesting to me.
author: Joakim Noah

quote: I do not regard advertising as entertainment or an art form, but as a medium of information.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.
author: Truman Capote

quote: A compromise is the art of dividing a cake in such a way that everyone believes he has the biggest piece.
author: Ludwig Erhard

quote: I did study the art of being a barber because I wanted to figure out what my routine would be. Do you start in the front or back? Top or bottom? Swivel the chair or walk around? What I did discover is there's no such thing as the perfect haircut!
author: Sean Patrick Thomas

quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: When I am finishing a picture, I hold some God-made object up to it - a rock, a flower, the branch of a tree or my hand - as a final test. If the painting stands up beside a thing man cannot make, the painting is authentic. If there's a clash between the two, it's bad art.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: I think it's the pain and suffering that drive you to become an artist. The art itself should be the pain, sort of exorcising every demon and making you feel like you're a person that matters.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: Art is the path to being spiritual.
author: Piet Mondrian

quote: It is Homer who has chiefly taught other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
author: Aristotle

quote: Art is the provocation for talking about enigma and the search for sense in human life. One can do that by telling a story or writing about a fresco by Giotto or studying how a snail climbs up a wall.
author: John Berger

quote: When the bright angel dominates, out comes a great work of art, a Michelangelo David or a Beethoven symphony.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Good manners is the art of making those people easy with whom we converse. Whoever makes the fewest people uneasy is the best bred in the room.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The orbit of human vision has widened and art has annexed fresh territories that were formerly denied to it.
author: Max Bill

quote: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I've been called many names like perfectionist, difficult and obsessive. I think it takes obsession, takes searching for the details for any artist to be good.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: The art of acceptance is the art of making someone who has just done you a small favor wish that he might have done you a greater one.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The art of motherhood involves much silent, unobtrusive self-denial, an hourly devotion which finds no detail too minute.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Our individual lives cannot, generally, be works of art unless the social order is also.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: I paint with shapes.
author: Alexander Calder

quote: I really believe there are things nobody would see if I didn't photograph them.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: A beautiful body perishes, but a work of art dies not.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Art hurts. Art urges voyages - and it is easier to stay at home.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Venice is the perfect place for a phase of art to die. No other city on earth embraces entropy quite like this magical floating mall.
author: Jerry Saltz

quote: If my art has nothing to do with people's pain and sorrow, what is 'art' for?
author: Ai Weiwei

quote: I am interested in mathematics only as a creative art.
author: G. H. Hardy

quote: Democracy is the art of thinking independently together.
author: Alexander Meiklejohn

quote: Art is to me the glorification of the human spirit, and as such it is the cultural documentation of the time in which it is produced.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: I come from a real working class background, and I didn't know anyone sophisticated - except I saw Edie Sedgewick once at the Art Museum in Philly. She had these black leotards and little black pumps and this big ermine cape and all these white dogs and black sunglasses and black eyes. She was classy!
author: Patti Smith

quote: Art is moral passion married to entertainment. Moral passion without entertainment is propaganda, and entertainment without moral passion is television.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: The most momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Guided only by their feeling for symmetry, simplicity, and generality, and an indefinable sense of the fitness of things, creative mathematicians now, as in the past, are inspired by the art of mathematics rather than by any prospect of ultimate usefulness.
author: E. T. Bell

quote: Postmodernism surely requires an even greater grasp of symbolism, as it's increasingly an art of gesture alone.
author: Andrew Eldritch

quote: So vast is art, so narrow human wit.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
author: Carl Rogers

quote: That's why people listen to music or look at paintings. To get in touch with that wholeness.
author: Corita Kent

quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: An artist is a dreamer consenting to dream of the actual world.
author: George Santayana

quote: Painting is a nail to which I fasten my ideas.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Once an object has been incorporated in a picture it accepts a new destiny.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I don't paint things. I only paint the difference between things.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: An artist cannot speak about his art any more than a plant can discuss horticulture.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: In art the best is good enough.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Art is the triumph over chaos.
author: John Cheever

quote: Fine art is that in which the hand, the head, and the heart of man go together.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: The artist's world is limitless. It can be found anywhere, far from where he lives or a few feet away. It is always on his doorstep.
author: Paul Strand

quote: Murals in restaurants are on a par with the food in museums.
author: Peter De Vries

quote: It may be that the deep necessity of art is the examination of self-deception.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: All good art is an indiscretion.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: When I work, and in my art, I hold hands with God.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
author: William Morris

quote: I rarely draw what I see. I draw what I feel in my body.
author: Barbara Hepworth

quote: Be careful that you do not write or paint anything that is not your own, that you don't know in your own soul.
author: Emily Carr

quote: A painting that is well composed is half finished.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: Layer by layer art strips life bare.
author: Robert Musil

quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: I like to pretend that my art has nothing to do with me.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: The philistine provides the best definition of art. Anything that makes him rage is first class.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: Artists live in unknown spaces and give themselves over to following something unknown.
author: Kiki Smith

quote: Sleeping is no mean art: for its sake one must stay awake all day.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The art of delegation is one of the key skills any entrepreneur must master.
author: Richard Branson

quote: Art is the proper task of life.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.
author: Nicki Minaj

quote: In general, the art of government consists of taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
author: Voltaire

quote: The artist must create a spark before he can make a fire and before art is born, the artist must be ready to be consumed by the fire of his own creation.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The essential function of art is moral. But a passionate, implicit morality, not didactic. A morality which changes the blood, rather than the mind.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Art should be created for life, not for the museum.
author: Jean Nouvel

quote: There's not a lot of art forms where you can control your presentation and your ideas.
author: Gerard Way

quote: If trees can create art, if they can encircle the globe seven times in one year, if prisoners can grow plants and raise frogs, then perhaps there are other static entities that we hold inside ourselves, like grief, like addictions, like racism, that can also change.
author: Nalini Nadkarni

quote: The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: The old, sad art colors are gone. Now I paint bright colors. I paint paintings which are happy, where children are laughing and playing with animals. I paint paradise on Earth. I still paint sadness sometimes, but there is sadness in the world, too.
author: Margaret Keane

quote: Dying is an art, like everything else. I do it exceptionally well. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real. I guess you could say I've a call.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: If a man devotes himself to art, much evil is avoided that happens otherwise if one is idle.
author: Albrecht Durer

quote: Disco deserved a better name, a beautiful name because it was a beautiful art form. It made the consumer beautiful. The consumer was the star.
author: Barry White

quote: Ethics is in origin the art of recommending to others the sacrifices required for cooperation with oneself.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: I've learned that I'm most powerful when I'm doing my art.
author: Andre Benjamin

quote: When you create art, the world has to wait.
author: Will Smith

quote: Art's a very metaphysical activity. It's something that enriches the parameters of your life, the possibilities of being, and you touch transcendence and you change your life. And you want to change the life of others, too. That's why people are involved with art.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: So many gods, so many creeds, so many paths that wind and wind while just the art of being kind is all the sad world needs.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: The only honest art form is laughter, comedy. You can't fake it... try to fake three laughs in an hour - ha ha ha ha ha - they'll take you away, man. You can't.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: If thou art a man, admire those who attempt great things, even though they fail.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: I think we're much smarter than we were. Everybody knows that abstract art can be art, and most people know that they may not like it, even if they understand there's another purpose to it.
author: Roy Lichtenstein

quote: Pop art is the inedible raised to the unspeakable.
author: Leonard Baskin

quote: Yes, I believe that the art of winning is through intimidation, and not necessarily do you have to speak about it.
author: Mark Spitz

quote: The body is your instrument in dance, but your art is outside that creature, the body.
author: Martha Graham

quote: The sadness of the incomplete, the sadness that is often Life, but should never be Art.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Art is based on emotion, but being macho is based on ego; the wall protecting that emotion.
author: Miguel

quote: Graffiti's always been a temporary art form. You make your mark and then they scrub it off.
author: Banksy

quote: When I go to an art gallery and stand in front of a painting, I don't want someone telling me what I should be seeing or thinking; I want to feel whatever I feel, see whatever I see, and figure out what I figure out.
author: James Frey

quote: I make static art, not dynamic art. That's what I do.
author: Michael Heizer

quote: I love that works of art are printed so that anyone can buy them. The variety of what they put on little postcards astounds me.
author: Leonard Lauder

quote: I don't believe in the school of hard knocks, although I've had them. All that stuff about whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger is so not true. Do you know what makes you stronger? When people treat you and your art with dignity.
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: The job of art is to chase ugliness away.
author: Bono

quote: Art is for healing ourselves, and everybody needs their own personal art to heal up their problems.
author: Linda Ronstadt

quote: Until I began to learn to draw, I was never much interested in looking at art.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: Back in third grade, they used to say, 'Take whatever talent you have and think of something you can do with it.' I liked to draw, but what could I do with it? Maybe I could be an art dealer - nah, can't see myself doing that. Maybe I could do commercial arts?
author: The Notorious B.I.G.

quote: All the great works of art, the cathedrals - the Gothic cathedrals and the splendid Baroque churches - are a luminous sign of God, and thus are truly a manifestation, an epiphany of God.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

quote: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Art is the symbol of the two noblest human efforts: to construct and to refrain from destruction.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Every great work of art has two faces, one toward its own time and one toward the future, toward eternity.
author: Lester Bangs

quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Where thou art, that is home.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The challenge is to practice politics as the art of making what appears to be impossible, possible.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: The art of statesmanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence.
author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand

quote: Art is much less important than life, but what a poor life without it.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: The art of government is the organisation of idolatry.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The notion that the public accepts or rejects anything in modern art is merely romantic fiction. The game is completed and the trophies distributed long before the public knows what has happened.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: The greater the decrease in the social significance of an art form, the sharper the distinction between criticism and enjoyment by the public. The conventional is uncritically enjoyed, and the truly new is criticized with aversion.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: They say Princes learn no art truly, but the art of horsemanship. The reason is, the brave beast is no flatterer. He will throw a prince as soon as his groom.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Nothing right can be accomplished in art without enthusiasm.
author: Robert Schumann

quote: Good art however 'immoral' is wholly a thing of virtue. Good art can NOT be immoral. By good art I mean art that bears true witness, I mean the art that is most precise.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: If a patron buys from an artist who needs money, the patron then makes himself equal to the artist; he is building art into the world; he creates.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: We work in the dark - we do what we can - we give what we have. Our doubt is our passion and our passion is our task. The rest is the madness of art.
author: Henry James

quote: It is not hard to understand modern art. If it hangs on a wall it's a painting, and if you can walk around it it's a sculpture.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: The forms of art are inexhaustible but all lead by the same road of aesthetic emotion to the same world of aesthetic ecstasy.
author: Clive Bell

quote: Everything that is strong in me has gone into my art work.
author: Robert Crumb

quote: It's an art to live with pain... mix the light into gray.
author: Eddie Vedder

quote: Oh literature, oh the glorious Art, how it preys upon the marrow in our bones. It scoops the stuffing out of us, and chucks us aside. Alas!
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: All the world old is queer save thee and me, and even thou art a little queer.
author: Robert Owen

quote: No art is any good unless you can feel how it's put together. By and large it's the eye, the hand and if it's any good, you feel the body. Most of the best stuff seems to be a complete gesture, the totality of the artist's body; you can really lean on it.
author: Frank Stella

quote: The arts equally have distinct departments, and unless photography has its own possibilities of expression, separate from those of the other arts, it is merely a process, not an art.
author: Alfred Stieglitz

quote: Painting is an essentially concrete art and can only consist of the representation of real and existing things.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: I think art is inherently nonviolent and it actually occupies your mind with creation rather than destruction.
author: Anthony Kiedis

quote: In any art, you don't know in advance what you want to say - it's revealed to you as you say it. That's the difference between art and illustration.
author: Aaron Siskind

quote: The art of life is to live in the present moment, and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God Himself.
author: Emmet Fox

quote: Tell me thy company, and I'll tell thee what thou art.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: I think body-image issues are not just a dancer thing. I think we're much more in tune and aware because the body is our instrument and art, and we stare at ourselves in a mirror all day, but I feel like it's something that every woman experiences and every girl experiences.
author: Misty Copeland

quote: It was Public Art, defined as art that is purchased by experts who are not spending their own personal money.
author: Dave Barry

quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Art for art's sake is a philosophy of the well-fed.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: What was any art but a mould in which to imprison for a moment the shining elusive element which is life itself - life hurrying past us and running away, too strong to stop, too sweet to lose.
author: Willa Cather

quote: The art of being a slave is to rule one's master.
author: Diogenes

quote: What marks the artist is his power to shape the material of pain we all have.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
author: Jerzy Kosinski

quote: With color one obtains an energy that seems to stem from witchcraft.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: Art gives people a reason to be alive.
author: Marilyn Manson

quote: The concept of commercialism in the fashion and art world is looked down upon. You know, just to think, 'What amount of creativity does it take to make something that masses of people like?' And, 'How does creativity apply across the board?'
author: Kanye West

quote: All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Cinema is an art form that is designed to go across borders. And as a filmmaker, the only way I can direct a movie is when I feel close to my culture.
author: Denis Villeneuve

quote: I'm afraid that if you look at a thing long enough, it loses all of its meaning.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: In art, the obvious is a sin.
author: Edward Dmytryk

quote: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
author: James Whistler

quote: Jazz is known all over the world as an American musical art form and that's it. No America, no jazz. I've seen people try to connect it to other countries, for instance to Africa, but it doesn't have a damn thing to do with Africa.
author: Art Blakey

quote: The word 'art' interests me very much. If it comes from Sanskrit, as I've heard, it signifies 'making.' Now everyone makes something, and those who make things on a canvas with a frame, they're called artists. Formerly, they were called craftsmen, a term I prefer. We're all craftsmen, in civilian or military or artistic life.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: As humans we look at things and think about what we've looked at. We treasure it in a kind of private art gallery.
author: Thom Gunn

quote: Enjoying art is a personal matter. It's made up by contemplation, silence, abstraction.
author: Renzo Piano

quote: The sole art that suits me is that which, rising from unrest, tends toward serenity.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The work of art is a scream of freedom.
author: Christo

quote: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Architects, sculptors painters, we all must return to the crafts! For art is not a 'profession.' There is no essential difference between the artist and the craftsman. The artist is an exalted craftsman.
author: Walter Gropius

quote: To catch a husband is an art to hold him is a job.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The art of living is the art of knowing how to believe lies.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: Besides black art, there is only automation and mechanization.
author: Federico Garcia Lorca

quote: One thing that took a while to really adjust to was, you do it for the the art, for the money, for being together and having a good time, but you do it for all those people out there who really care about the show. We are now talking about a show we did over 20 years ago.
author: Steve Kanaly

quote: Art? That's a man's name.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Art is the objectification of feeling.
author: Herman Melville

quote: The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
author: Theodore Dreiser

quote: Impressionism it is the birth of Light in painting.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: Japanese people accept that art and commerce will be blended; and, in fact, they are surprised by the rigid and pretentious Western hierarchy of 'high art.'
author: Takashi Murakami

quote: The fine art of preparing sushi is something that you watch and learn.
author: Nobu Matsuhisa

quote: There is no more difficult art to acquire than the art of observation, and for some men it is quite as difficult to record an observation in brief and plain language.
author: William Osler

quote: The art of reading between the lines is as old as manipulated information.
author: Serge Schmemann

quote: Works of art make rules rules do not make works of art.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: Any fool can have bad luck the art consists in knowing how to exploit it.
author: Frank Wedekind

quote: When you look at art made by other people, you see what you need to see in it.
author: Alberto Giacometti

quote: Actually I think Art lies in both directions - the broad strokes, big picture but on the other hand the minute examination of the apparently mundane. Seeing the whole world in a grain of sand, that kind of thing.
author: Peter Hammill

quote: But I am a lover of all kinds of art. And I just can't stick to one thing. I guess I could if I made myself, but I'd always be looking the other way, for other things.
author: Andre Benjamin

quote: I want to try and be as involved in the art of filmmaking as possible. I feel that the only way to really do that is to take on as many roles as possible, whether it be as an actor, an editor, a director, a cinematographer.
author: Joe Swanberg

quote: Art is solace; art is vision, and when I pick up a literary work, I am a consumer of literature for its own sake.
author: Wole Soyinka

quote: Art is permitted to survive only if it renounces the right to be different, and integrates itself into the omnipotent realm of the profane.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Take care to sell your horse before he dies. The art of life is passing losses on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The art of pleasing is the art of deception.
author: Luc de Clapiers

quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
author: Stella Adler

quote: Every good painter paints what he is.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: Art cannot be modern. Art is primordially eternal.
author: Egon Schiele

quote: The finest works of art are precious, among other reasons, because they make it possible for us to know, if only imperfectly and for a little while, what it actually feels like to think subtly and feel nobly.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want to own.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: An artist cannot fail it is a success to be one.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: Art is like a border of flowers along the course of civilization.
author: Lincoln Steffens

quote: I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: If you cannot learn to love real art, at least learn to hate sham art and reject it.
author: William Morris

quote: The marble not yet carved can hold the form of every thought the greatest artist has.
author: Michelangelo

quote: I've always enjoyed feeling a connection to the avant-garde, such as Dada and surrealism and pop art. The only thing the artist can do is be honest with themselves and make the art they want to make. That's what I've always done.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: There's this shop in New York I go to it has bones and fossils and insects that are like works of art. I have a few on my wall.
author: Eva Green

quote: I love my Force Fins, which are the kind of fins Special Forces use and really are adapted from the fins of fish. They're very efficient. They are so beautiful, a pair is in the Museum of Modern Art. The set I have are ruby red. I call them my ruby flippers.
author: Sylvia Earle

quote: The art of the bird is to conceal its nest both as to position and as to material, but now and then it is betrayed into weaving into its structure showy and bizarre bits of this or that, which give its secret away and which seem to violate all the traditions of its kind.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Art is feminine... Look, if you're handsome and young and beautiful, well, people are always going to say that you're gay.
author: Juan Gabriel

quote: While I recognize the necessity for a basis of observed reality... true art lies in a reality that is felt.
author: Odilon Redon

quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Maturity implies otherness... The art of living is the art of living with.
author: Julius Gordon

quote: You should carefully study the Art of Reasoning, as it is what most people are very deficient in, and I know few things more disagreeable than to argue, or even converse with a man who has no idea of inductive and deductive philosophy.
author: William John Wills

quote: Artists today think of everything they do as a work of art. It is important to forget about what you are doing - then a work of art may happen.
author: Andrew Wyeth

quote: Anime is intended to have ambiguous features. That's part of the art form.
author: M. Night Shyamalan

quote: I always imagined myself somehow as an electron around some atom, and you're just, like, bouncing around and spinning. There was a never-ending supply of places to go, people to see, things to do, and fitting it all in became kind of an art.
author: Tom Freston

quote: What is extraordinary about contemporary art is the energy - it has our energy. New energy. Pieces hundreds of years old are beautiful from an aesthetic point of view, but without our modern energy.
author: Victor Pinchuk

quote: Making beautiful things for everyday use is a wonderful thing to do - making life flow more easily - but art confronts life, allowing it to stop and perhaps change direction - they are completely different.
author: Antony Gormley

quote: The thing is that as you grow through life, the pursuit of art and the pursuit of new ideas, all these things keeps your mind elastic.
author: Patti Smith

quote: Someone made me a Leaf Coneybear finger puppet. Someone made me a portrait of me on some chocolate. I'm keeping it. I daren't eat such a work of art. It's so unique and so fun that fans do that. It's incredibly flattering. I like it when people spend time on me. People don't spend the same amount of time on my brother who's an insurance broker.
author: Barrett Foa

quote: Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice journalism what will be grasped at once.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: It is our art that has an opportunity to leave a footprint in the sand. They don't wrap fish in our work.
author: Hugh Newell Jacobsen

quote: Irresponsibility is part of the pleasure of all art it is the part the schools cannot recognize.
author: James Joyce

quote: We have lost the art of sharing and caring.
author: Hun Sen

quote: Art to me is an anecdote of the spirit, and the only means of making concrete the purpose of its varied quickness and stillness.
author: Mark Rothko

quote: But what does interest me is the notion that if you do a lot of work it means there's a potential for other people to understand that a lot of things are possible with a sustained effort and that the broadening of experiences is possible and I think that's all art can be.
author: Richard Serra

quote: Very few people possess true artistic ability. It is therefore both unseemly and unproductive to irritate the situation by making an effort. If you have a burning, restless urge to write or paint, simply eat something sweet and the feeling will pass.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Masterpieces of art possess immense potential to advance a worldview that could help assuage the societal terrors posed by globalization, the most thoroughgoing socioeconomic upheaval since the Industrial Revolution, which has set off a pandemic of retrogressive nationalism, regional separatism, and religious extremism.
author: Martin Filler

quote: Film editing is now something almost everyone can do at a simple level and enjoy it, but to take it to a higher level requires the same dedication and persistence that any art form does.
author: Walter Murch

quote: We are only beginning to learn what to say in a photograph. The world we live in is a succession of fleeting moments, any one of which might say something significant.
author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

quote: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: With an apple I will astonish Paris.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: All art is dependent on technology because it's a human endeavour, so even when you're using charcoal on a wall or designed the proscenium arch, that's technology.
author: George Lucas

quote: You begin with the possibilities of the material.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: An empty canvas is full.
author: Robert Rauschenberg

quote: If I didn't choose art, I would have become an astronomer.
author: Peter Max

quote: I owe much to mother. She had an expert's understanding, but also approached art emotionally.
author: David Rockefeller

quote: I quickly realized that this medium had a lot to offer someone like me. To do Disney-quality hand-drawn cartoons, you have to be a master of two art forms. Seriously, you have to be able to draw like a Leonardo da Vinci or a Michelangelo. But also you have to know movement and timing and control that through 24 frames a second.
author: John Lasseter

quote: Art attracts us only by what it reveals of our most secret self.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

quote: For me, acting is about the art of it and it's about being on a film set and doing your thing, painting a blank canvas.
author: Shailene Woodley

quote: As long as you're true to you, you believe it and you make others believe it, then what you're doing is just art. If you give everybody a blank canvas and some paint, not everybody's picture is going to be exactly the same, but it's still art. I just do what I do.
author: Jake Owen

quote: I don't feel I'm trying to make art. I'm trying to make interesting things. People can relate to that.
author: Thomas Heatherwick

quote: My philosophy is that I'm an artist. I perform an art not with a paint brush or a camera. I perform with bodily movement. Instead of exhibiting my art in a museum or a book or on canvas, I exhibit my art in front of the multitudes.
author: Steve Prefontaine

quote: There is so much art can do to enlighten people, no matter what their views might be. If art can't go there or doesn't elevate the social consciousness in some way, then we are in peril.
author: Octavia Spencer

quote: In a storm, I think, 'What if the gospel be not true? Then thou art, of all men, most foolish. For what has thou given up thy goods, thy ease, thy friends, thy reputation, thy country, thy life?'
author: John Wesley

quote: I think of art, at its most significant, as a DEW line, a Distant Early Warning system that can always be relied on to tell the old culture what is beginning to happen to it.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: The reward of art is not fame or success but intoxication: that is why so many bad artists are unable to give it up.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: In art and dream may you proceed with abandon. In life may you proceed with balance and stealth.
author: Patti Smith

quote: Winners have the ability to step back from the canvas of their lives like an artist gaining perspective. They make their lives a work of art - an individual masterpiece.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: Flirting is the gentle art of making a man feel pleased with himself.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: Homer has taught all other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
author: Aristotle

quote: Everyone thinks they can write a play you just write down what happened to you. But the art of it is drawing from all the moments of your life.
author: Neil Simon

quote: Every happening, great and small, is a parable whereby God speaks to us, and the art of life is to get the message.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: I think in art, but especially in films, people are trying to confirm their own existences.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: We should always remember that sensitiveness and emotion constitute the real content of a work of art.
author: Maurice Ravel

quote: The art of Peace I practice has room for each of the world's eight million gods, and I cooperate with them all. The God of Peace is very great and enjoins all that is divine and enlightened in every land.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: To improve the golden moment of opportunity, and catch the good that is within our reach, is the great art of life.
author: William Samuel Johnson

quote: Part of the joy of looking at art is getting in sync in some ways with the decision-making process that the artist used and the record that's embedded in the work.
author: Chuck Close

quote: Extreme complication is contrary to art.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Thou art not for the earth, nor for the Heaven the world is for thee, thou art not for the world.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: How can anybody learn anything from an artwork when the piece of art only reflects the vanity of the artist and not reality?
author: Lou Reed

quote: When thou art above measure angry, bethink thee how momentary is man's life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The man of genius is he and he alone who finds such joy in his art that he will work at it come hell or high water.
author: Stendhal

quote: In art as in love, instinct is enough.
author: Anatole France

quote: Even a true artist does not always produce art.
author: Carroll O'Connor

quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: Art is man's expression of his joy in labor.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Advertising is the greatest art form of the 20th century.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: Wherever art appears, life disappears.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: What is art but a way of seeing?
author: Saul Bellow

quote: A work of art has no importance whatever to society. It is only important to the individual.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: An artist is forced by others to paint out of his own free will.
author: Willem de Kooning

quote: I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Rules and models destroy genius and art.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: To be an artist includes much; one must possess many gifts - absolute gifts - which have not been acquired by one's own effort. And, moreover, to succeed, the artist much possess the courageous soul.
author: Kate Chopin

quote: Art depends on luck and talent.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: To make pictures big is to make them more powerful.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quote: If you know somethin' well, you can always paint it but people would be better off buyin' chickens.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: The worst state of affairs is when science begins to concern itself with art.
author: Paul Klee

quote: What I wish to show when I paint is the way I see things with my eyes and in my heart.
author: Raoul Dufy

quote: Art is pattern informed by sensibility.
author: Herbert Read

quote: An empty canvas is a living wonder... far lovelier than certain pictures.
author: Wassily Kandinsky

quote: My paintings are not about what is seen. They are about what is known forever in the mind.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: I am not strong on perfection.
author: Jasper Johns

quote: The goal of art was the vital expression of self.
author: Alfred Stieglitz

quote: I realize that protest paintings are not exactly in vogue, but I've done many.
author: Robert Indiana

quote: Most art is fragile and some should be placed and never moved away.
author: Donald Judd

quote: The principle of art is to pause, not bypass.
author: Jerzy Kosinski

quote: Painting is the passage from the chaos of the emotions to the order of the possible.
author: Balthus

quote: There hasn't been any art yet. Art is just beginning.
author: Constantin Brancusi

quote: I will preach with my brush.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: I see myself and many artists like me as the torchbearers through these dark ages.
author: John Zorn

quote: My hand is the extension of the thinking process - the creative process.
author: Tadao Ando

quote: In art, all who have done something other than their predecessors have merited the epithet of revolutionary; and it is they alone who are masters.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: If you don't get noticed, you don't have anything. You just have to be noticed, but the art is in getting noticed naturally, without screaming or without tricks.
author: Leo Burnett

quote: What strikes me is the fact that in our society, art has become something which is only related to objects, and not to individuals, or to life.
author: Michel Foucault

quote: Art is dangerous. It is one of the attractions: when it ceases to be dangerous you don't want it.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: One of the most striking signs of the decay of art is when we see its separate forms jumbled together.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

quote: Art comes to you proposing frankly to give nothing but the highest quality to your moments as they pass.
author: Walter Pater

quote: The art of politics consists in knowing precisely when it is necessary to hit an opponent slightly below the belt.
author: Konrad Adenauer

quote: There is in fact no such thing as art for art's sake, art that stands above classes, art that is detached from or independent of politics. Proletarian literature and art are part of the whole proletarian revolutionary cause.
author: Mao Zedong

quote: To my mind the old masters are not art their value is in their scarcity.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Infatuated, half through conceit, half through love of my art, I achieve the impossible working as no one else ever works.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: So long as the system of competition in the production and exchange of the means of life goes on, the degradation of the arts will go on; and if that system is to last for ever, then art is doomed, and will surely die; that is to say, civilization will die.
author: William Morris

quote: All art is quite useless.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Interpretation is the revenge of the intellectual upon art.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Modernity is the transient, the fleeting, the contingent; it is one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immovable.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Life is like art. You have to work hard to keep it simple and still have meaning.
author: Charles de Lint

quote: If thou art master to thyself, circumstances shall harm thee little.
author: Martin Farquhar Tupper

quote: I mean, art for art's sake is ridiculous. Art is for the sake of one's needs.
author: Carl Andre

quote: Every time you work, you have to do it all over again, to rid yourself of this dross. I suppose for a person who is not an artist or not attempting art, it is not dross, because it is the common exchange of everyday life.
author: Carl Andre

quote: Performance art is the ultimate in creativity. Since it has so many possibilities at creativity, it's essence tends to become creativity.
author: Jack Bowman

quote: Every mind which has given itself to self-expression in art is aware of a directing agency outside its conscious control which it has agreed to label 'inspiration'.
author: Norman Lindsay

quote: Salesmanship, too, is an art; the perfection of its technique requires study and practice.
author: James Cash Penney

quote: When it came to my art, I went my own way and did not follow the trends.
author: Frank Frazetta

quote: I don't really believe in 'directions' in art; the rope twists as you follow it, that's all.
author: Graham Nelson

quote: Although all the good arts serve to draw man's mind away from vices and lead it toward better things, this function can be more fully performed by this art, which also provides extraordinary intellectual pleasure.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quote: There's room for the Gap, but the joy of dressing is an art.
author: John Galliano

quote: The biggest problem with every art is by the use of appearance to create a loftier reality.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: The true art of memory is the art of attention.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Thou must be emptied of that wherewith thou art full, that thou mayest be filled with that whereof thou art empty.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Photograph: a picture painted by the sun without instruction in art.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: What I didn't know was I was deeply attracted to the big space.
author: David Hockney

quote: Art is parasitic on life, just as criticism is parasitic on art.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: The business of art is to reveal the relation between man and his environment.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: I can't bear art that you can walk round and admire. A book should be either a bandit or a rebel or a man in the crowd.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Evil is done without effort, naturally, it is the working of fate; good is always the product of an art.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: The waking mind is the least serviceable in the arts.
author: Henry Miller

quote: I think an artist's responsibility is more complex than people realize.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.
author: Marcel Duchamp

quote: In seeking wisdom thou art wise in imagining that thou hast attained it - thou art a fool.
author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

quote: To make us feel small in the right way is a function of art men can only make us feel small in the wrong way.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Trying to force creativity is never good.
author: Sarah McLachlan

quote: Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: That's the motivation of an artist - to seek attention of some kind.
author: James Taylor

quote: The more horrifying this world becomes, the more art becomes abstract.
author: Ellen Key

quote: Some people act as though art that is for a mass audience is not good art, and I think this has been a very negative thing. I know that I have wanted very much to write books that are accessible to the widest audience possible.
author: bell hooks

quote: I always feel like the art's there and I just see it, so it's not really a lot of work.
author: Damien Hirst

quote: I think it's pretentious to create art just for the sake of stroking the artists ego.
author: Lou Reed

quote: Of all lies, art is the least untrue.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Art: If the object of poetry is, to make men, then poetry is the heir of prophecy.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: What makes photography a strange invention is that its primary raw materials are light and time.
author: John Berger

quote: No heirloom of humankind captures the past as do art and language.
author: Theodore Bikel

quote: Any work that aspires, however humbly, to the condition of art should carry its justification in every line.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: I love the gallery, the arena of representation. It's a commercial world, and morality is based generally around economics, and that's taking place in the art gallery.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: Like art and politics, gangsterism is a very important avenue of assimilation into society.
author: E. L. Doctorow

quote: It's clever, but is it Art?
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Art produces ugly things which frequently become more beautiful with time. Fashion, on the other hand, produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Thou art my single day, God lends to leaven What were all earth else, with a feel of heaven.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Every artist writes his own autobiography.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: The worse my drawings were, the more beautiful did the originals appear.
author: John James Audubon

quote: I don't understand it. Jack will spend any amount of money to buy votes but he balks at investing a thousand dollars in a beautiful painting.
author: Jackie Kennedy

quote: I think you learn a lot about a country from its art. To me, it's part of the drama of life. It teaches you that there are places, moments and incidents in other cultures that genuinely have a life of their own.
author: Michael Palin

quote: Art begins with resistance - at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.
author: Andre Gide

quote: There is no prejudice that the work of art does not finally overcome.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Art is the collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
author: Andre Gide

quote: All great art is born of the metropolis.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: The art of living lies not in eliminating but in growing with troubles.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: The vitality of a new movement in Art must be gauged by the fury it arouses.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: I'm just really impressed by oil paintings - I don't see how people do it! That's the style I like: classic oil paintings. Abstract art just isn't my thing.
author: Brittany Howard

quote: True art selects and paraphrases, but seldom gives a verbatim translation.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: The perfection of art is to conceal art.
author: Quintilian

quote: I've never really had a hobby, unless you count art, which the IRS once told me I had to declare as a hobby since I hadn't made money with it.
author: Laurie Anderson

quote: Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.
author: Anish Kapoor

quote: Time extracts various values from a painter's work. When these values are exhausted the pictures are forgotten, and the more a picture has to give, the greater it is.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: An artist never really finishes his work, he merely abandons it.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Painting and writing are solitary arts.
author: Conrad Hall

quote: Art is one thing that can go on mattering once it has stopped hurting.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Art is subject to arbitrary fashion.
author: Kary Mullis

quote: Art is the final cunning of the human soul which would rather do anything than face the gods.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: All art is a struggle to be, in a particular sort of way, virtuous.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: And as I reinvent myself and I'm constantly curious about everything, I can't wait to see what's around the corner in newfound art and entertainment and exploration.
author: Pam Grier

quote: Artists themselves are not confined, but their output is.
author: Robert Smithson

quote: I'm not gonna give the British Government the joy of keeping taxing me. They don't tax art. And all my cars are just a collection of art.
author: Jay Kay

quote: Advertising is the art of the tiny. You have to tell a complete a story and deliver a complete message in a very encapsulated form. It disciplines you to cut away extraneous information.
author: Dick Wolf

quote: Art distills sensations and embodies it with enhanced meaning.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: The best artists know what to leave out.
author: Charles de Lint

quote: Mournful and yet grand is the destiny of the artist.
author: Franz Liszt

quote: To write is to become disinterested. There is a certain renunciation in art.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Discipline in art is a fundamental struggle to understand oneself, as much as to understand what one is drawing.
author: Henry Moore

quote: When artists make art, they shouldn't question whether it is permissible to do one thing or another.
author: Sol LeWitt

quote: People were more interested in the phenomena than the art itself. This, combined with the growing interest in collecting art as an investment and the resultant boom in the art market, made it a difficult time for a young artist to remain sincere without becoming cynical.
author: Keith Haring

quote: I cry out for order and find it only in art.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Art must take reality by surprise.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.
author: Jack Bowman

quote: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
author: Novalis

quote: When I make art, I think about its ability to connect with others, to bring them into the process.
author: Jim Hodges

quote: Of what use were the arts if they were only the reproduction and the imitation of life?
author: Alfred de Vigny

quote: It has taken me years of struggle, hard work and research to learn to make one simple gesture, and I know enough about the art of writing to realize that it would take as many years of concentrated effort to write one simple, beautiful sentence.
author: Isadora Duncan

quote: Art is a revolt against fate. All art is a revolt against man's fate.
author: Andre Malraux

quote: When looking at any significant work of art, remember that a more significant one probably has had to be sacrificed.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Paint the essential character of things.
author: Camille Pissarro

quote: I just started making Bloody Marys. I always thought they looked gross, then I tasted one. There's an art to it, from the Tabasco to the Worcestershire.
author: Tara Reid

quote: The creative act lasts but a brief moment, a lightning instant of give-and-take, just long enough for you to level the camera and to trap the fleeting prey in your little box.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: Great artists suffer for the people.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: Draw your pleasure, paint your pleasure, and express your pleasure strongly.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: It is the mark of great art that its appeal is universal and eternal.
author: Clive Bell

quote: Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
author: Amy Lowell

quote: It's an old ploy of the bourgeoisie. They keep a standing 'art' to defend their collapsing culture.
author: George Grosz

quote: Photography is a major force in explaining man to man.
author: Edward Steichen

quote: When that shutter clicks, anything else that can be done afterward is not worth consideration.
author: Edward Steichen

quote: Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.
author: Edward Steichen

quote: A room hung with pictures is a room hung with thoughts.
author: Joshua Reynolds

quote: I want to make exalted art. A successful image has pictorial lift. I am looking for whatever is up there.
author: Frank Stella

quote: An artist carries on throughout his life a mysterious, uninterrupted conversation with his public.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: Art thou the King of the Jews?
author: Pontius Pilate

quote: Contrary to general belief, an artist is never ahead of his time but most people are far behind theirs.
author: Edgard Varese

quote: To paint is a possessing rather than a picturing.
author: Philip Guston

quote: Painting seems like some kind of peculiar miracle that I need to have again and again.
author: Philip Guston

quote: One must always draw, draw with the eyes, when one cannot draw with a pencil.
author: Balthus

quote: Art is Art. Everything else is everything else.
author: Ad Reinhardt

quote: Art is too serious to be taken seriously.
author: Ad Reinhardt

quote: I decided on the spot that I would be an artist, and I assure you, it was no ordinary artist I had in mind.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: Art is anything people do with distinction.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: The art of using deceit and cunning grow continually weaker and less effective to the user.
author: John Tillotson

quote: Great art is never produced for its own sake. It is too difficult to be worth the effort.
author: Robert Quillen

quote: It is more important to click with people than to click the shutter.
author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

quote: I think of my peace paintings as one long poem, with each painting being a single stanza.
author: Robert Indiana

quote: I was the least Pop of all the Pop artists.
author: Robert Indiana

quote: Artists don't talk about art. Artists talk about work. If I have anything to say to young writers, it's stop thinking of writing as art. Think of it as work.
author: Paddy Chayefsky

quote: My art springs from my desire to have things in the world which would otherwise never be there.
author: Carl Andre

quote: Real art is one of the most powerful forces in the rise of mankind, and he who renders it accessible to as many people as possible is a benefactor of humanity.
author: Zoltan Kodaly

quote: As I very much liked to draw and paint as a child, I entered a special art program in high school, which was very much like being in an art school imbedded in a regular high school curriculum.
author: Jerome Isaac Friedman

quote: To me that's what art is about - when you don't really have any control over your desires to do it.
author: Noah Taylor

quote: Great art is an instant arrested in eternity.
author: James Huneker

quote: Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.
author: Alfred Sisley

quote: There is always a multitude of reasons both in favor of doing a thing and against doing it. The art of debate lies in presenting them the art of life lies in neglecting ninety-nine hundredths of them.
author: Hale White

quote: I take photographs with love, so I try to make them art objects. But I make them for myself first and foremost - that is important.
author: Jacques-Henri Lartigue

quote: Art is a liaison between some sort of deranged mentality and others who are not going through it.
author: John Chamberlain

quote: The arts are an even better barometer of what is happening in our world than the stock market or the debates in congress.
author: Hendrik Willem Van Loon

quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Politics have no relation to morals.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
author: Plato

quote: Suppose you were an idiot, and suppose you were a member of Congress; but I repeat myself.
author: Mark Twain

quote: In politics stupidity is not a handicap.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Democracy is when the indigent, and not the men of property, are the rulers.
author: Aristotle

quote: I like to see myself as a bridge builder, that is me building bridges between people, between races, between cultures, between politics, trying to find common ground.
author: T. D. Jakes

quote: The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: The first lesson of economics is scarcity: there is never enough of anything to fully satisfy all those who want it. The first lesson of politics is to disregard the first lesson of economics.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: The most practical kind of politics is the politics of decency.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: I weep for the liberty of my country when I see at this early day of its successful experiment that corruption has been imputed to many members of the House of Representatives, and the rights of the people have been bartered for promises of office.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: To err is human. To blame someone else is politics.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: It is enough that the people know there was an election. The people who cast the votes decide nothing. The people who count the votes decide everything.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: People say satire is dead. It's not dead it's alive and living in the White House.
author: Robin Williams

quote: No real social change has ever been brought about without a revolution... revolution is but thought carried into action.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: Just because you do not take an interest in politics doesn't mean politics won't take an interest in you.
author: Pericles

quote: If you put the federal government in charge of the Sahara Desert, in 5 years there'd be a shortage of sand.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: A fool and his money are soon elected.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A leader in the Democratic Party is a boss, in the Republican Party he is a leader.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: Bad politicians are sent to Washington by good people who don't vote.
author: William E. Simon

quote: Conservatives are not necessarily stupid, but most stupid people are conservatives.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The unique thing about our country is that we have Hindus, Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Parsis, and people of all other religions. We have temples and mosques, gurdwaras and churches. But we do not bring all this into politics... This is the difference between India and Pakistan.
author: Lal Bahadur Shastri

quote: We all have our likes and our dislikes. But... when we're doing news - when we're doing the front-page news, not the back page, not the op-ed pages, but when we're doing the daily news, covering politics - it is our duty to be sure that we do not permit our prejudices to show. That is simply basic journalism.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: America's present need is not heroics but healing not nostrums but normalcy not revolution but restoration.
author: Warren G. Harding

quote: In politics, nothing happens by accident. If it happens, you can bet it was planned that way.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: What I'm asking for is hard. It's easier to be cynical; to accept that change isn't possible, and politics is hopeless, and to believe that our voices and actions don't matter. But if we give up now, then we forsake a better future.
author: Barack Obama

quote: If you believe you can make a difference, not just in politics, in public service, in advocacy around all these important issues, then you have to be prepared to accept that you are not going to get 100 percent approval.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: The secret of getting things done is to act!
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: If you have always believed that everyone should play by the same rules and be judged by the same standards, that would have gotten you labeled a radical 60 years ago, a liberal 30 years ago and a racist today.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: In politics... never retreat, never retract... never admit a mistake.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: A diplomat is a person who can tell you to go to hell in such a way that you actually look forward to the trip.
author: Caskie Stinnett

quote: Establishing lasting peace is the work of education all politics can do is keep us out of war.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: I must not write a word to you about politics, because you are a woman.
author: John Adams

quote: There are no morals in politics there is only expedience. A scoundrel may be of use to us just because he is a scoundrel.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: As a black woman, my politics and political affiliation are bound up with and flow from participation in my people's struggle for liberation, and with the fight of oppressed people all over the world against American imperialism.
author: Angela Davis

quote: I think one of the great problems we have in the Republican Party is that we don't encourage you to be nasty. We encourage you to be neat, obedient, loyal and faithful and all those Boy Scout words, which would be great around a campfire but are lousy in politics.
author: Newt Gingrich

quote: I hate all politics. I don't like either political party. One should not belong to them - one should be an individual, standing in the middle. Anyone that belongs to a party stops thinking.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: In war, you can only be killed once, but in politics, many times.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The activist is not the man who says the river is dirty. The activist is the man who cleans up the river.
author: Ross Perot

quote: In human life, economics precedes politics or culture.
author: Park Geun-hye

quote: Objective journalism is one of the main reasons that American politics has been allowed to be so corrupt for so long.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: It has been said that politics is the second oldest profession. I have learned that it bears a striking resemblance to the first.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: I'm not an old, experienced hand at politics. But I am now seasoned enough to have learned that the hardest thing about any political campaign is how to win without proving that you are unworthy of winning.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quote: Politics: A strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles. The conduct of public affairs for private advantage.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: The modern conservative is engaged in one of man's oldest exercises in moral philosophy; that is, the search for a superior moral justification for selfishness.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Globalisation has made us more vulnerable. It creates a world without borders, and makes us painfully aware of the limitations of our present instruments, and of politics, to meet its challenges.
author: Anna Lindh

quote: Politics is the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didn't happen.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: We are losing sight of civility in government and politics. Debate and dialogue is taking a back seat to the politics of destruction and anger and control. Dogma has replaced thoughtful discussion between people of differing views.
author: James McGreevey
